sub_topic: Identifying the clique number of a graph.
message_1:
What is the clique number of the following graph?
    
    1 --- 2 --- 3
     \   |   / \
      \  |  /   \
       \ | /     \
         4 ------- 5
message_2: The clique number of a graph is the size of the largest complete subgraph (clique) in the graph. In the given graph, the largest complete subgraph is formed by vertices 2, 3, and 4, which form a triangle. Therefore, the clique number of this graph is 3.
